reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Investing Towards Malaria Elimination

description.narrative: Eritrea - Malaria - Ministry of Health of the State of Eritrea - MOH. This program has the following goals: To reduce malaria incidence by 50% by 2021 from 2015 baseline of 8 per 1,000 to 4 per 1,000.. Achieve zero local malaria transmission in additional 17 sub-zobas by 2021.. The objectives of this program are: By 2021, 100% of fever cases presenting to health providers will be promptly tested for malaria, and 100% of the confirmed malaria cases treated according to national guidelines.. By 2021, 100% of population at risk of malaria will be covered by effective, appropriate and quality assured vector control methods.. By 2021, strengthen surveillance, monitoring and evaluation in all malaria transmission settings including introduction of case based surveillance in 17 sub-zobas earmarked for elimination.. By 2021, increase proportion of people utilizing malaria control interventions to at least 80% as compared to2012 levels (ITN use (54.2% to 80%), early treatment seeking behaviour (28.8% to 80%), mosquito breeding source reduction by villages (55% to 80%)).. By 2021, develop requisite capacity in program management at national level, zoba level and in 50% of sub-zobas in order to strengthen the programme towards malaria elimination.

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for ERI-M-MOH
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of households in targeted areas that received Indoor Residual Spraying during the reporting period
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Percentage of health facilities reporting no stock-outs of essential drugs
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Proportion of targeted risk groups receiving long-lasting insecticidal-nets
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Proportion of population at risk potentially covered by long lasting insecticidal nets distributed
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Outcome indicator for ERI-M-MOH
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population with access to an ITN within their household
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of households sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Percentage of existing ITNs used the previous night
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people and/or sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net
Percentage of women attending antenatal care
Impact indicator for ERI-M-MOH
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Malaria test positivity rate
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
